:1:

IN IN IN THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY

IN IN IN INSOLVENCY INSOLVENCY INSOLVENCY

REPORT REPORT REPORT NO. 158 OF 2006 NO. 158 OF 2006 NO. 158 OF 2006

IN IN IN

INSOLVENCY INSOLVENCY INSOLVENCY NO. 103 OF 1970 NO. 103 OF 1970 NO. 103 OF 1970

Re.: G.V. Puranik.

... Insolvent.

Ex-parte :

M/s. Anandji Jethabhai & Co. ... Petitioning Creditors.

.....

Mr. G.G. Ketkar, 1st Asstt. to Official Assignee.

.....

CORAM CORAM CORAM : DR. D.Y. CHANDRACHUD,J. : DR. D.Y. CHANDRACHUD,J. : DR. D.Y. CHANDRACHUD,J.

ND ND ND DECEMBER, 2006. DECEMBER, 2006. DECEMBER, 2006.

P.C. P.C. P.C. : : :

.

The Official Assignee has prayed that the balance

of

Rs.24,799.38

ps.

be transferred

to

the

Unclaimed

Dividend

Capital

Account

under Rule of

the

Bombay

Insolvency

Rules, and thereafter to

the

Unclaimed

Dividend

Capital

Revenue Account and the account may

be

closed for the administrative purposes. The relevant

details are as follows :-

(i)

The order of adjudication was passed on 13th

September 1971.

(ii)

The aggregate balance lying with the account of the

estate is Rs.27,516.50. No further recoveries are

possible in the estate.

.

The report is made absolute in terms of prayer

clause (a).
